alert.note: Alert for Anoka; Hennepin (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 18 at 10:35AM CDT until April 25 at 11:00PM CDT by NWS Minneapolis
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Minnesota and Wisconsin... Mississippi River at Fridley abv 37th Ave NE affecting Anoka and Hennepin Counties. Rum River near St. Francis affecting Anoka County. Minnesota River at Savage affecting Scott, Hennepin, Dakota and Carver Counties. Minnesota River At New Ulm affecting Blue Earth, Nicollet and Brown Counties. Minnesota River at Granite Falls HWY 212 affecting Chippewa, Renville and Yellow Medicine Counties. Minnesota River at Montevideo affecting Lac qui Parle, Chippewa and Yellow Medicine Counties. Minnesota River At Morton affecting Renville and Redwood Counties. Sauk River at St. Cloud affecting Stearns County. South Fork Crow River at Delano affecting Wright and Hennepin Counties. South Fork Crow River below Mayer affecting Carver County. Crow River at Rockford affecting Wright and Hennepin Counties. Mississippi River at Red Wing L/D 3 affecting Goodhue, Dakota and Pierce Counties. Mississippi River at Red Wing affecting Goodhue and Pierce Counties. Mississippi River at St. Paul affecting Ramsey, Dakota and Washington Counties. Mississippi River near Hastings L/D 2 (COE) affecting Goodhue, Dakota, Washington and Pierce Counties. Mississippi River At Hwy 169 at Champlin affecting Anoka and Hennepin Counties. Mississippi River AT Hwy 610 @ Brooklyn Pk affecting Anoka and Hennepin Counties. Mississippi River at St. Cloud affecting Wright, Stearns and Sherburne Counties. St Croix River at Stillwater affecting Washington, Pierce and St. Croix Counties. Redwood River near Redwood Falls affecting Redwood County. ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Minnesota and Wisconsin... Snake River At Mora affecting Kanabec County. Chippewa River at Durand affecting Pepin, Buffalo and Dunn Counties. .The combination of spring snowmelt and recent rainfall will continue to cause widespread flooding on area rivers. Upcoming rainfall is expected to prolong high river flows into the coming week. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE TUESDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Major flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Mississippi River at Fridley abv 37th Ave NE. * WHEN...Until Tuesday evening. * IMPACTS...At 17.0 feet, Water begins to encroach on roads along the East Bank. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 930 AM CDT Tuesday, the stage was 16.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 17.0 feet Friday morning. It will then fall below flood stage on Monday. - Flood stage is 16.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 17.0 feet on 04/07/1943. &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
